mocap.recording.start.different_player.t: You can use "/mocap recording stop" and then try again to start recording

Recording stopped - waiting for decision...
Use "/mocap recording save <recording_name>" to save it
or "/mocap recording stop" to discard it.
mocap.recording.save.nothing_to_save.tip: You need to start recording first
To start recording take any action or use "/mocap recording start" again
mocap.recording.save.recording_not_stopp: To save recording you need to first stop it using "/mocap recording stop"
Recording with this name may already exist

mocap.scenes.remove_from.error: §lError:§r unable to remove element from scene!
mocap.scenes.element_info.failed: Failed to get scene element information!

mocap.scenes.error.file_not_exists: Scene with this name doesn't exist
mocap.scenes.error.wrong_element_pos: Element with the given number doesn't exist
mocap.scenes.error.wrong_element_pos.tip: Use "/mocap scenes listElements [scene]" to get element numbers
mocap.playing.start.warning.unknown_enti: Trying to use unknown entity as player
mocap.playing.start.warning.skin.profile: Failed to load skin from player profile
mocap.playing.start.warning.skin.file: Failed to load skin from file
mocap.playing.start.warning.skin.mineski: Failed to load skin from mineskin.org

mocap.settings.info.name: §lName:§r %s
mocap.settings.info.about.playingSpeed: §lAbout:§r Allows you to change speed of played recording or scene
mocap.settings.info.about.recordingSync: §lAbout:§r Makes recording of complex scenes easier by synchronizing start of played scene with start of recording
mocap.settings.info.about.playBlockActio: §lAbout:§r Plays back placing, destroying, and interacting with blocks
mocap.settings.info.about.setBlockStates: §lAbout:§r At the playback start sets block states to those before the start of recording
mocap.settings.info.about.allowMineskinR: §lAbout:§r Allows HTTPS requests to mineskin.org to load skins
mocap.settings.info.about.canPushEntitie: §lAbout:§r Makes fake players push other entities
mocap.settings.info.about.useCreativeGam: §lAbout:§r Sets fake players game mode to creative (monsters will ignore them)
mocap.settings.info.about.dropFromBlocks: §lAbout:§r Enables drop from destroyed blocks (recommended with "playItemEntities" disabled to prevent duplicates)
mocap.settings.info.about.trackVehicleEn: §lAbout:§r Enables tracking (recording) vehicle entities (like boats or horses)
mocap.settings.info.about.trackOtherEnti: §lAbout:§r Enables tracking (recording) entities other than vehicles and items
mocap.settings.info.about.trackPlayedEnt: §lAbout:§r Enables tracking (recording) entities that are currently played
mocap.settings.info.about.entityTracking: §lAbout:§r Limits the entity tracking distance (>0 - tracking radius in blocks; 0 - disable tracking; -1 - distance not limited)
mocap.settings.info.about.playVehicleEnt: §lAbout:§r Enables playing vehicle entities (like boats or horses)
mocap.settings.info.about.playOtherEntit: §lAbout:§r Enables playing entities other than vehicles and items
mocap.settings.info.about.entitiesAfterP: §lAbout:§r Determines what will happen with entities after playback (-1 - release it as a normal entity; 0 - left untouched; 1 - remove; 2 - kill with animation)
mocap.settings.info.about.preventSavingE: §lAbout:§r Prevents game from saving played entities in case of for example leaving game
mocap.settings.info.about.recordPlayerDe: §lAbout:§r Enables recording player death and stops recording at that moment
mocap.settings.info.about.fluentMovement: §lAbout:§r Sets distance to played entity for player to receive additional packets for more fluent movements (>0 - distance in blocks; 0 - disable fluent movements; -1 - no limit)
mocap.help:
%s - §lHelp§r
  /mocap recording [...] - Recording player movements
  /mocap recordings [...] - Managing recording files
  /mocap scenes [...] - Creating and modifying scenes
  /mocap playing [...] - Playing scenes and recordings
  /mocap settings [...] - Shows and modifies settings
  /mocap info - Displays information about mod
  /mocap help - Displays this message
§lHow to use:§r
- First, you need to start recording using "/mocap recording start". It will record all your movements or movements of a player given as an argument. 
- Then, you can stop recording using "/mocap recording stop" and save it with "/mocap recording save <name>".
- Use "/mocap playing start <name>" to play recording.
- You can also create scenes to which you can add multiple recordings or other scenes, with parameters like player name, position offset, or start delay.
- To create scene use "/mocap scenes add <scene_name>". Then, add your recording using "/mocap scenes addTo <scene_name> <recording_name> [delay] [x_offset] [y_offset] [z_offset] [player_name] [skin_source_type] [skin_source]" (you can skip arguments in square brackets if you want).
- To play scene use "/mocap playing start .<scene_name>" - you need to put a dot before the scene name.
- By putting a dot before name, when using "/mocap scenes addTo ...", you can also add scenes to other scenes.
mocap.file.info.name: §lName:§r %s
mocap.warning.custom_skin_cache_limit: §lWarning:§r custom skin cache size reached limit!
mocap.warning.custom_skin_cache_limit.ti: Rejoin the world to clear it
mocap.error.improper_name.character: You can only use lowercase letters, numbers, an underscore, a dash, or a dot
mocap.error.improper_name.dot_first: You can't use a dot as a first character
